III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section Rule 126. The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
Description administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and other
staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions required by these
1

administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement and to
provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents.
Allegation Youth is being threatened by other youth at the facility. The staff
are aware and are not responding.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint was interviewed via telephone on February 13,
2023 and denied having specific staff names that are not
responding to youth that are making threats to other youth.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2023. Director stated Youth A threatens her peers
as well as receives threats from her peers at the house. Director
reported Youth A is currently suspended from school for fighting
with a boy and two days ago attempted to throw a computer at a
peer in the house. Director reported Youth A and Youth C often
threaten each other then turn around and are best friends.
Director stated staff verbally redirect the youth, separate the
youth, and will place the youth in different groups when this type
of behavior takes place. Director denied any staff receiving write
ups or coaching notes for not intervening when youth are
threatening one another.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2023. Youth A stated, “I make threats as well as get
threatened.” Youth A reported the threats are made during
arguments when staff are present. Youth A stated staff verbally
redirect but it does not always work or stop the threats. Youth A
stated staff will have the youth that is being threatened leave the
room, talk with that youth and the youth that is threatening and
that usually calms the situation. Youth A reported if the
threatening continues youth can earn a STT (special treatment
team) where the behavior is addressed and if bad enough can be
placed on “pause.” Youth A described “pause” as not being able
to have any privileges, like leaving the house for fun activities.
Youth A stated, “all staff in general are great and do their job.”
Youth A reported she could not think of anything different staff
could do. Youth A stated, “If I’m being honest with you, the staff
do say something and address the threatening.”
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2023. Therapist stated in yesterday’s session Youth
A reported not feeling safe at the facility because Youth C was
threatening Youth A. Therapist reported Youth A and Youth C’s
2

relationship as badgering back and forth, both threatening one
another, then being best friends and wanting to do everything
together. Therapist denied Youth A mentioning any specific staff
that is not responding to any youth making threats. Therapist
stated she has heard multiple staff redirect youth for making
threatening or inappropriate comments.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2023. Supervisor described Youth A as
antagonizing and threatening her peers at the house. Supervisor
stated Youth A has made threats to her peers and her peers,
generally Youth C, threaten Youth A. Supervisor reported when
this happens the youth are verbally redirected, separated, placed
in different groups and the time is limited that the youth can see or
be around one another. Supervisor stated if the behavior
continues there can be a STT meeting where the youth is held
accountable for their action. Supervisor stated staff watch the
youth to see if a situation is brewing and try to separate the youth
before the threats start. Supervisor denied ever seeing a staff not
intervene if youth are threatening or being inappropriate.
Supervisor reported not being aware of any staff being written up
or receiving a coaching note for not intervening when youth are
being threatening or inappropriate.
Youth B, Youth C, Youth D and Youth E were interviewed
individually face to face at the facility on February 13, 2023.
All the youth reported staff just don’t let it (threatening) happen,
handle it, tell the kids to stop, separate them, place in separate
groups or rooms in the house, give a STT or being placed on
pause. All the youth denied staff not intervening when youth
threaten one another or say something inappropriate.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as all five-youth interviewed
reported staff respond appropriately by redirecting youth who
make threatening comments. All five youth described the actions
staff take and reported staff are responding to the threats.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
